name: Martin Fowler
background: Chief Scientist at Thoughtworks. Author of Patterns of Enterprise Application Architecture, Refactoring. Leading voice on microservices architecture decisions.

principles.name: Asynchronous Work
principles.description: Decouple producers and consumers. Use queues, events, or async patterns for scalability.
principles.falsification: When asynchronous work leads to worse outcomes than alternatives

principles.name: Backwards Compatibility
principles.description: New versions should not break existing clients. Enable gradual migration.
principles.falsification: When backwards compatibility leads to worse outcomes than alternatives

principles.name: Build vs Buy
principles.description: Evaluate whether to build custom solutions or buy/use existing ones. Focus resources on core differentiators.
principles.falsification: When build vs buy leads to worse outcomes than alternatives

principles.name: CQRS (Command Query Responsibility Segregation)
principles.description: Separate read and write models when read and write patterns differ significantly. Don't use CQRS everywhere - it adds complexity. Use it when read scaling, different data shapes, or event sourcing justify it.
principles.falsification: When cqrs (command query responsibility segregation) leads to worse outcomes than alternatives
